title: Singapore Grand Prix 2019 LIVE: F1 stream, UK time, updates from today's race
text:
Formula 1’s rising star Charles Leclerc wowed the crowds in Singapore yesterday as he secured pole position for today’s Grand Prix.

Hamilton, who will line up alongside the 21-year-old on the front row, was unable to do anything except watch as the Monegasque stormed to his third straight pole and fifth of the season -- more than any other driver.

Will he be able to get his revenge today? Follow live coverage of the Singapore Grand Prix below:

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Singapore F1 key points Race due to start at 13.10 GMT

Charles Leclerc starts on pole

Lewis Hamilton one place behind him

LAP 33 A Ferrari one-two now. Giovinazzi's adventure coming to a conclusion now as he moves down to fourth, Verstappen third. LAP 31 Verstappen into fifth, Ricciardo down to sixth. A brilliant race so far. LAP 31 Never mind, Vettel now takes the lead easily. LAP 31 Giovinazzi still leads...nose bleed imminent surely. Advertisement LAP 30 Vettel into second! Gasly shoved aside (almost literally). Nearly some major contact there. LAP 29 Vettel moving through the traffic. He's into third behind Gasly in second. LAP 28 Giovinazzi leads...although he hasn't pitted. LAP 27 Hamilton finally pits. Bottas hanging back to allow his teammate to challenge. Advertisement LAP 26 Leclerc worried about his tyres despite pitting five laps earlier. LAP 25 Vettel, Leclerc, and Verstppen waiting to pounce as the top five haven't yet pitted. LAP 23 Bottas comes out of the pits in ninth with Hulkenberg breathing down his neck. LAP 22 Hamilton stays out! He thinks he's good for now as he looks to fend off the Ferraris. Advertisement LAP 21 Vettel has now gone past Leclerc. Can the German take the lead when Hamilton does pit? LAP 21 Leclerc into the pits, Hamilton stays out to see if he can gain some ground. LAP 20 Vettel into the pits, as is Verstappen LAP 20 Leclerc hasn't shrugged off Hamilton who is now less than a second behind the Ferrari. Advertisement LAP 18 Great racing at the back! Perez moves past Kubica into 16th. LAP 17: Hamilton feeling the tyre drop-off. He's 1.5 seconds adrift of the leader Leclerc now. LAP 16 Leclerc given the green light to push on now. LAP 15 Hamilton is within DRS range of Leclerc who leads. The Ferrari driver may need to get a move on after a comfortable start. Advertisement 1 2 3 Next

Race preview

Where can I watch it?

Sky Sports F1 have live coverage of the race. Their programming begins at 11.30am.

Channel 4 has highlights of the race. They start at 7pm on Sunday evening.

Can I stream the race?

You can watch the Singapore Grand Prix through Now TV for £9.99.

Where is it?

The Singapore Grand Prix takes place at the Marina Bay Street Circuit.

What time is it?

The race is due to start at 13.10 GMT.

What is our prediction?

Lewis Hamilton to end Charles Leclerc’s hot streak by finishing first.
